title: Barbell Chest Press on Stability Ball

items: Choose a weight that is appropriate for your fitness level and goals.
Sit on the stability ball with your feet flat on the ground and your knees bent at a 90-degree angle.
Hold the barbell with an overhand grip, with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Slowly lower the barbell towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
Pause for a moment when the barbell is just above your chest.
Push the barbell back up to the starting position, keeping your elbows close to your body.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
When finished, carefully place the barbell back on the rack.
Engages multiple muscle groups including chest, shoulders, triceps, and core
Improves overall upper body strength and endurance
Increases stability and balance due to use of stability ball
Allows for a greater range of motion compared to traditional bench press
Can be modified for different fitness levels by adjusting weight and stability ball size
